entry.title: Bash: Move an Entire Directory of Files
entry.summary: I recently wanted to nest all the files in a folder one level deeper. Which meant I needed to move all the files except for the nested folder I created. This will move all files, excluding the directory new-folder: ls|grep -v new-folder|xargs -I % mv

entry.title: Linux: Scheduled Jobs With crontab
entry.summary:
Today I learned about crontab, which for those of us coming from the Windows world is the equivalent of the Windows Task Scheduler. If I had known how easy it was to use I would have started using it a long time ago.
